articles.title: Retail investors are 'optimistic,' but 'realistic' going into 2025
articles.content: Retail investors are feeling bullish about the market (^DJI, ^IXIC, ^GSPC) in 2025, eToro's fourth quarter Retail Investor Beat shows. eToro investment analyst Bret Kenwell joins Josh Lipton and Seana Smith on Market Domination to discuss how retail investors are thinking about the market headed into the new year. Kenwell says retail investors are "optimistic" but "realistic" for the new year. "They're looking to gain more exposure to crypto in 2025. They're looking to gain more exposure to equities in 2025. But they're also looking to raise some cash here," he says, later adding: "I think they're being prudent, but also, you know, keeping one foot in at least is so they keep getting taking advantage of, you know, more gains to come in 2025 if that is the case." The analyst reports that the survey found retail investors to prefer the financials sector and big-cap tech, including Magnificent Seven names and other artificial intelligence (AI) plays. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination here. This post was written by Naomi Buchanan.

articles.title: "Real-world AI" is the next phase of this tech: Portfolio mgr.
articles.content: Nightview Capital portfolio manager Dan Crowley discusses the transformative potential of artificial intelligence (AI) in 2025 on Market Domination Overtime. "We think we're headed toward a period of rapid technological shifts. Historically, whenever that's happened, significant opportunities have been unlocked," Crowley explains. He believes AI's economic impact could rival that of the internet revolution. Crowley identifies "real-world AI" as the sector's next evolution, highlighting two key investment opportunities. First, he points to "entirely new product-category" companies like Tesla (TSLA), which is advancing autonomous driving technology. Second, he sees potential in established companies with "existing business lines," such as Amazon (AMZN), which can leverage AI to enhance operational efficiency. "We're kind of trying to move into the next phase here of where we see AI playing out," he tells Yahoo Finance. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime here. This post was written by Angel Smith

articles.title: Apple Seen Having Strong Holiday Sales. Stock Hits Record High.
articles.content: Apple stock notched a record high after a Wall Street analyst said the consumer electronics giant is likely to have strong holiday season sales.

articles.title: Why Broadcom Was Rallying Again Today
articles.content: Shares of Broadcom (NASDAQ: AVGO) rallied 5.3% on Monday, as of 1:18 p.m. ET.  Broadcom received a bullish note and price target upgrade from a Wall Street sell-side analyst today, building upon the blowout 2027 guidance management gave on the company's recent earnings call.  On Monday, UBS analyst Timothy Arcuri raised his target on Broadcom from $220 to $270 per share, while maintaining his bullish stance on the name.

articles.title: CFPB vs. Walmart, iPhone 16, Apollo and Workday: Top Stocks
articles.content: The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) is suing retailer Walmart (WMT) for forcing its delivery drivers to use pricey deposit accounts in order to receive payments. Wedbush senior analyst Dan Ives published a note stating that the global demand for Apple's iPhone 16 (AAPL) has increased slightly above expectations. Apollo Global Management (APO) and Workday (WDAY) have begun trading on the S&P 500 (^GSPC) on Monday. Disclosure: Yahoo Finance is owned by Apollo Global Management. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Wealth here. This post was written by Luke Carberry Mogan.

articles.title: Here’s Why Nvidia (NVDA) Is A Long Game, Longer Than You Think
articles.content: Nvidia has lately been in the headlines for all the wrong reasons. They are having trouble shipping Blackwell GPUs, facing regulatory pressure in China, and justifying to the US government how its chips ended up in China’s hands. Amidst all this, its stock has hardly gone anywhere in the last 6 months but is still […]
